titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elwyn Kechley Scrapbook 1927-1934
titlestmt.author: Cheryl Gunselman

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-02-06.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.abstract: Elwyn Kechley Scrapbook, 1927-1934. While a student at Washington State College, Kechley played in a band that performed on cruise ships in 1931 and 1932, and most of the material in the scrapbook relates to these experiences. Materials include photographs, newspapers (whole issues and clippings), and memorabilia.

scopecontent.p: Elwyn Kechley Scrapbook, 1927-1934. While a student at Washington State College, Kechley played in a band that performed on cruise ships in 1931 and 1932, and most of the material in the scrapbook relates to these experiences. Materials include photographs, newspapers (whole issues and clippings), and memorabilia. Included among the miscellaneous materials are two issues of Crimson and Gray, the newspaper of Chehalis (WA) High School (1927 February 22, 1928 March 14), and undated literature about the Isaacson Angle Blade Trac-Dozer.

bioghist.p: Elwyn Kechley (1910-2008) was the son of the Rev. E.L. Kechley and Luella (Henderson) Kechley of Nebraska. He attended school in Chehalis, WA, and graduated from Washington State College in 1934. During his years at WSC, he worked on cruise ships as part of a band or orchestra.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

processinfo.p: Cheryl Gunselman processed this collection in 2018.

acqinfo.p: Gerald Kechley donated this collection to the Washington State University Libraries in 2018 (MS-2018-02), via Liz Kennedy.
